meanings.definition: The act of making something concrete or real.
meanings.sent1: Her concretizations of abstract ideas helped her classmates understand better.
meanings.sent2: The concretizations of his dreams into achievable goals motivated him to work harder.
meanings.sent3: The concretizations of her wild imagination sometimes surprised even herself.
meanings.sent4: His concretizations of success were like building blocks, each one leading to the next.
meanings.sent5: The concretizations of the architect's vision were evident in every corner of the building.

meanings.definition: The result of making something concrete or real.
meanings.sent1: The concretizations of their efforts were visible in the finished product.
meanings.sent2: She admired the concretizations of her ideas in the form of beautiful artwork.
meanings.sent3: The concretizations of their teamwork brought a sense of accomplishment to the group.
meanings.sent4: The concretizations of his love for her were seen in the little gestures he did every day.
meanings.sent5: The concretizations of his hard work were celebrated by his colleagues.
